get.description: An endpoint to retrieve the obstacles of a specific floor id of the geo store.Parameter 'id' represents the floor id, starting with 0.

put.description: An endpoint to completely replace the obstacles of a specific floor id of the geo store. The obstacles will replace the existing list of obstacles . An empty list will delete the current obstacles.Every obstacle must contain atleast 3 edges and vertices each, and the number of vertices must equal the number of obstacles. Parameter 'id' represents the floor id, starting with 0.

get.summary: Get a list of all false ack test runs

post.description: Starts a false ack test and returns the id of the test result. A test involving 2000 frames is expected to take approximately one minute. All transmission will be paused during the test and automatically resume afterwards.

get.summary: Get a list of all coverage test runs

post.description: Starts a false ack test and returns the id of the test result. All transmission will be paused during the test and automatically resume afterwards.
Stops a running coverage test and returns the id of the test result in the location header.

post.summary: Stop displaying port numbers on transceivers.
post.description: Stops displaying port numbers on transceivers. All transmission will be resumed after the stop.

post.summary: Start displaying port numbers on transceivers.
post.description: Starts displaying port numbers on transceivers. All transmission will be paused before the start and automatically resumed after the timeout.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path of the folder to upload images to. If no path is specified the files will be uploaded to the root directory.

images.description:
Images to save.
Allowed formats are: jpg, bmp, gif, png, jpeg.
Maximum image size is: 20MiB.
If running in Plaza, image width and height must be less than or equal to the largest screen dimension of any supported ESL device in the system.
Curl-parameter examples:
 -F "images=@image1.png;type=image/png" -F "images=@image2.gif;type=image/gif"

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the image to get

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path of the new image. If no path is specified your file will be uploaded to the root directory.

image.description:
Image to save.
Allowed formats are: jpg, bmp, gif, png, jpeg.
Maximum image size is: 20MiB
If running in Plaza, image width and height must be less than or equal to the largest screen dimension of any supported ESL device in the system.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path of the image or folder of images to delete

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Set to true to delete folder, false (default) to delete image.

400.description: Label barcode does not match barcode in link

post.summary: Update item image for a page
post.description:
Update the image on the page of an item.

```
# Example usage, note the @ before the file path
curl 'https://username:password@officeserver.pricer.com:3306/api/public/core/v1/items/13/page/0?resize=0' -F 'imageFile=@/path/to/image.png'
```
This will upload the image to item 13 on page 0 without resizing, which in turn update all labels that are displaying the given item.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description:
The id of the item of which to update the image.

If the item does not exist and `SystemParameters.ITEM_MUST_EXIST` is `true`, an error will be thrown.
If the item does not exist and `SystemParameters.ITEM_MUST_EXIST` is `false`, the item will be created.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description:
The index of the page of the item to update.
Values are between 0 and 127 inclusive.
If there is no such page for the given image size, an error will be thrown.

parameters.name: resize
parameters.description:
Whether or not to resize the image. Valid values are
|   Value | Enum                  | Description                                                |
| ------- | --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
|       0 | NO_RESIZE             | The image is not resized                                   |
|       1 | MAINTAIN_ASPECT_RATIO | The image is resized if the aspect ratio can be maintained |
|       2 | FORCED_FIT            | The image is resized regardless of earlier aspect ratio    |

If `NO_RESIZE` is selected, then at most one image will be updated.
For `MAINTAIN_ASPECT_RATIO` and `FORCED_FIT` all the existing image item properties for the given page will be updated.
If the value does not correspond to a valid option, an error will be thrown.

200.description:
The request was accepted.

An object with a request id is returned, and you can use the request id to check on the status of the request.
See `/api/public/core/v1/items-result/{requestId}`.

404.description: Item does not exist, and ITEM_MUST_EXIST is set to true

400.description: There was an error in the request. See message field in the response for details.

500.description: Unexpected internal server error. See message field in the response for details.

post.description: Flash all labels, linked to a single item, that have the capability to flash. The response will contain individual flash status for each label. Note that an empty list of labels in the response means that no labels are linked to the specified item.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The id of the item to flash

parameters.name: barcode
parameters.description: The barcode of the IR Key

400.description: Bad color format. Found neither hex nor rgb format

post.description: Flashes labels linked to items in provided list

400.description: Bad color format. Found neither hex nor rgb format

400.description: Not valid pricer label barcode, duration, action or priority

get.description: Fetches all labels with links

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description:
Level of detail in the projection of an label.
  • S includes:
    • barcode
    • modelName
    • plLocation
    • links
  • M includes:
    • All of S
    • homeTrx
    • plState
    • batteryState
    • lowBatteryDate
  • L includes:
    • All of M
    • lastTrxList
    • hardwareRevision
    • lastDisplayUpdate
    • batteryStateChanged
    • batteryStateLastConfirmed
    • batteryStateFirstEnteredLow
    • firstLinked
    • lastLinked
    • lastUpdate
    • lastOkUpdate
    • positions
      • manual
      • calculated
    • roamStatus
      • roamLevel
      • roamSweep
      • timeEnteredInRoaming

parameters.name: filter[barcode]
parameters.description: Filter response based on a label barcode or list of barcodes. As example: A4631053950916186 or G4421230000216185,G4421230000616189,G4421230001116185

parameters.name: filter[modelName]
parameters.description: Filter response based on modelName.

parameters.name: filter[plState]
parameters.description: Filter response based on state of the label.

parameters.name: filter[batteryState]
parameters.description: Filter response based on battery state of the label.

parameters.name: filter[labelType]
parameters.description: Filter response based on a type or a list of types.

parameters.name: sortProperty
parameters.description: The property to sort the response on.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: The sort direction for the response based on sortProperty. Default is ASC

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset to start at, 0-based. For example, specifying the start value 1000 with a limit of 500 will return 500 labels starting at position 1000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount, i.e. how many labels will be returned.

parameters.name: serializeDatesToIso8601
parameters.description: If dates should be serialized to ISO 8601 (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45+01:00). Defaults to false for backwards compatibility.

patch.description: Link labels to items as per defined in the provided listReturns an id to the asynchronous update request, which can be used to query the links-result endpoint.

parameters.name: accessCodeRegistrationKey
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to import labels from a previous system with ESL Security enabled. Without correct registration key the system cannot import already linked labels. This is useful when migrating On-Prem stores without having to unlink the entire store before migration.

Example: `XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX`

requestBody.description: A list of labels with links

500.description: Unable to save incoming request to disk

get.description: Fetches many items (paginated)

parameters.name: projection
parameters.description:
Level of detail in the projection of an item.
  • S includes:
    • id
    • name
    • price
  • M includes:
    • All of S
    • itemGroup
    • department
    • presentation
    • lastUpdated
    • validFrom
    • sics
    • properties
  • L includes:
    • All of M
    • links

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset to start at, 0-based. For example, specifying the start value 1000 with a limit of 500 will return 500 items starting at position 1000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount, i.e. how many items will be returned. Currently restricted to 1000.

delete.description:
Deletes a list of items by itemId.
Returns an id to the asynchronous delete request, which can be used to query the items-result endpoint.

patch.description:
Updates the items in the system with the provided list of items
Existing items will be updated. New items will be added.
Only populated fields will be updated. null or empty fields will not clear the corresponding field of existing items.Returns an id to the asynchronous update request, which can be used to query the items-result endpoint.

requestBody.description: A list of items to patch the existing list of items with.

400.description: Id missing on one or more items

get.description:
Returns metrics for item updates, including the total count of items and the number of updated items in different time intervals.
The returned metrics are cached and refreshed hourly.

ApiPublicConfigV1JobFrequency.description: The frequency at which a scheduled job is executed

parameters.description:
Parameters for the chosen frequency. Valid parameters are
| Parameters                                     | Enum               | Example  | Description                                                                             |
| ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------ | -------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Empty                                          | ONCE               | []       | The job runs once at the start time                                                     |
| One positive integer                           | INTERVAL           | [60]     | The job runs every X minutes                                                            |
| Empty                                          | DAILY              | []       | The job runs at the start time on every day                                             |
| One or more values between 1 and 7 inclusive   | WEEKLY             | [1, 5]   | The job runs at the start time on every day selected in a week (1 Monday - 7 Sunday)    |
| One or more values between 1 and 31 inclusive  | MONTHLY            | [1, 14]  | The job runs at the start time on every day selected in a month                         |
| Empty                                          | LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH  | []       | The job runs at the start time on every day                                             |

ApiPublicCoreV1FlashConfiguration.description: The configuration parameters for the flash item request.

duration.description: The flash duration in seconds. Defaults to 4. 0 (zero) means stop flashing. Accepted values are all between 0-1800. The flash duration behaviour of DM and segment labels differs a bit. When flashing a DM label the duration will be according to the given duration. For segment labels the duration will be the ceiling value in relation to: 0, 4, 8, 30, 60, 300, 900, 1800 in seconds. So the duration 61 will flash for 300 sec.

realTime.description: The transmission priority of the flash. When this is set to true it is seen as high priority, if set to false it is seen as normal priority. Defaults to true

color.description: Color of LED in RGB format without blanks: #ff0000 or rgb(255,0,0). The color will be set to closest supported color. Supported colors: GREEN, RED, BLUE, CYAN, MAGENTA, YELLOW, WHITE.

flashType.description: Flash type. Possible values 10 - Low, 20 - Semi-low, 30 - Semi-Strong-Strobe, 40 - Strong-Strobe, 50 - Strong.

ApiPublicCoreV1FlashLabelResponse.description: A class representing the response to a flash label request

result.description: The result of the flash led request

ApiPublicCoreV1FlashWithDepartmentConfig.description: The configuration parameters for the flash label request.

duration.description: The flash duration in seconds. Defaults to 4. 0 (zero) means stop flashing. Accepted values are all between 0-1800. The flash duration behaviour of DM and segment labels differs a bit. When flashing a DM label the duration will be according to the given duration. For segment labels the duration will be the ceiling value in relation to: 0, 4, 8, 30, 60, 300, 900, 1800 in seconds. So the duration 61 will flash for 300 sec.

realTime.description: The transmission priority of the flash. When this is set to true it is seen as high priority, if set to false it is seen as normal priority. Defaults to true

color.description: Color of LED in RGB format without blanks: #ff0000 or rgb(255,0,0). The color will be set to closest supported color. Supported colors: GREEN, RED, BLUE, CYAN, MAGENTA, YELLOW, WHITE.

flashType.description: Flash type. Possible values 10 - Low, 20 - Semi-low, 30 - Semi-Strong-Strobe, 40 - Strong-Strobe, 50 - Strong.

linkDepartment.description: The link department ID or alias

type.description:
Type of general setting: SINGLE, MULTIPLE or MAP.
SINGLE - A single value is expected.
MULTIPLE - A list of values (any size) is expected.
MAP - A list of an even number of values is expected.
